meanings.definition: To cut and gather a crop
meanings.sent1: Farmers reap wheat in the autumn.
meanings.sent2: She will reap the ripe apples from the tree.
meanings.sent3: The scarecrow tried to reap the corn, but it kept falling over.
meanings.sent4: The gardener reaps a bountiful harvest from the well-tended soil.
meanings.sent5: As the sun sets, the farmer reaps the fruits of his labor under the golden sky.

meanings.definition: To receive as a consequence of one's own actions
meanings.sent1: If you study hard, you will reap good grades.
meanings.sent2: He will reap the rewards of his dedication to his craft.
meanings.sent3: The lazy squirrel did not reap any nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: Kindness sown in the past reaps friendship in the present.
meanings.sent5: The athlete reaps the benefits of daily training with improved performance.

meanings.definition: To obtain something as a result of effort or action
meanings.sent1: By working diligently, you can reap success in your endeavors.
meanings.sent2: She reaped the praise of her peers for her outstanding work.
meanings.sent3: The detective reaped valuable information from the suspect's confession.
meanings.sent4: Hard work always reaps its own rewards in due time.
meanings.sent5: The explorer reaped the discovery of a hidden treasure after years of searching.
